Arn.description: The ARN of the route server peer.

Id.description: The ID of the route server peer.

RouteServerId.description: The ID of the route server associated with this peer.

EndpointEniId.description: The ID of the Elastic network interface for the route server endpoint.

EndpointEniAddress.description: The IP address of the Elastic network interface for the route server endpoint.

SubnetId.description: The ID of the subnet containing the route server peer.

VpcId.description: The ID of the VPC containing the route server peer.

PeerAsn.description: The Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Autonomous System Number (ASN) for the appliance. Valid values are from 1 to 4294967295. We recommend using a private ASN in the 64512–65534 (16-bit ASN) or 4200000000–4294967294 (32-bit ASN) range.

PeerLivenessDetection.description:
The liveness detection protocol used for the BGP peer.

The requested liveness detection protocol for the BGP peer.

- `bgp-keepalive` : The standard BGP keep alive mechanism ( [RFC4271](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc4271#page-21) ) that is stable but may take longer to fail-over in cases of network impact or router failure.
- `bfd` : An additional Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) protocol ( [RFC5880](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5880) ) that enables fast failover by using more sensitive liveness detection.

Defaults to `bgp-keepalive` .

BgpOptions.description: The BGP configuration options for this peer, including ASN (Autonomous System Number) and BFD (Bidrectional Forwarding Detection) settings.

description:
Specifies a BGP peer configuration for a route server endpoint.

A route server peer is a session between a route server endpoint and the device deployed in AWS (such as a firewall appliance or other network security function running on an EC2 instance).

BgpOptions.description: The BGP configuration options for this peer, including ASN (Autonomous System Number) and BFD (Bidrectional Forwarding Detection) settings.

PeerAddress.description: The IPv4 address of the peer device.

RouteServerEndpointId.description: The ID of the route server endpoint associated with this peer.

Tags.description: Any tags assigned to the route server peer.
